holidays.name: Titanic Remembrance Day
holidays.description: An emotional observance to honor the victims and heroes of the RMS Titanic tragedy of 1912, remembered worldwide every April 15 as the ship sank this day after striking an iceberg.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the historical event of the Titanic sinking on April 15, 1912.
holidays.funFact: The Titanic had only enough lifeboats for about half of the people on board, a fact that led to major changes in maritime safety laws.

holidays.name: International HAARP Day
holidays.description: A quirky nod to the High Frequency Active Auroral Research Program (HAARP), often surrounded by conspiracy theories, this day playfully pokes fun at mysterious science experiments involving the ionosphere.

holidays.name: National Titanic Remembrance Day
holidays.description: Not to be confused, this day solemnly honors the 1,517 lives lost when the Titanic sank, reminding us of the fragility of technology and human resilience.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the anniversary of the Titanic sinking in 1912.
holidays.funFact: April 15 is formally recognized in many countries as Titanic Remembrance Day to ensure the tragedy is never forgotten.
